distributional 0.3.1.9000
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Sampling distribution

Source: R/dist_sample.R
dist_sample.Rd

dist_sample(x)

Arguments

x

A list of sampled values.

Examples

# Univariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10)))

dist
#> <distribution[2]>
#> [1] sample[100] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#> [1]  0.05878281 10.02302305
variance(dist)
#> [1] 1.034325 1.138569
skewness(dist)
#> [1] -0.02505905  0.13199287
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>  [1]  0.12375655  1.57294874 -0.51592631  0.38979784  0.36872459  1.96135227
#>  [7]  0.36872459 -1.55219943  1.15967667 -0.08924413
#> 
#> [[2]]
#>  [1] 10.981803  8.732952  9.884081 11.439574 10.452510 10.894100  9.058320
#>  [8]  9.692725  9.886980  8.643562
#> 

density(dist, 1)
#> [1] 0.2061025 0.0000000

# Multivariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(cbind(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10))))

dist
#> <distribution[1]>
#> [1] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#> [1]  0.09794531 10.18657346
variance(dist)
#>              [,1]         [,2]
#> [1,]  1.090574285 -0.001742297
#> [2,] -0.001742297  1.219290989
skewness(dist)
#> [1] 0.007114105
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>             [,1]      [,2]
#>  [1,]  0.4454271 10.921357
#>  [2,] -0.8344039 10.974055
#>  [3,]  0.1429519  9.682378
#>  [4,]  1.6283713 10.584136
#>  [5,]  1.4378119 10.506102
#>  [6,]  0.2616554 10.096544
#>  [7,] -0.4636697  7.078100
#>  [8,]  1.6916281 11.521481
#>  [9,] -0.2889581  8.764006
#> [10,]  1.0861823  9.236873
#> 

density(dist, 1)
#> [1] 0.2388229 0.0000000
